required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intravitreal Adalimumab in Patients With Choroidal Neovascularization Secondary to Age-related Macular Degeneration
clinical_study.official_title: Open-label Clinical Trial to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of Intravitreal Adalimumab in Patients With Choroidal Neovascularization Secondary to Age-related Macular Degeneration Non-responders to the Conventional Treatment With Ranibizumab

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Adalimumab is a humanized recombinant monoclonal antibody fragment targeted against tumor necrosis factor. This study will assess the safety and efficacy of intravitreal adalimumab administered in patients with choroidal neovascularization secondary to age-related macular degeneration non-responders to the conventional treatment with intravitreal ranibizumab.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in retinal thickness measured by ocular coherence tomography
Changes in best corrected visual acuity

intervention.description: Intravitreal adalimumab injection (0,1 ml= 50 mcg) in the eye of the included patients. Patients will be followed up every week for a total of 4 weeks, and after every month until 6 months. If it is necessary, repeat the injection every month, maximum three months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Choroidal neovascularization secondary to age-related macular degeneration non-responders to the conventional treatment with ranibizumab (active choroidal neovascularization after loading phase of one injection per month for three consecutive months, followed by a maintenance phase with 5 injections in the last 12 months or 3 injections in the last 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Only one functional eye
- Hypersensitivity to adalimumab or any component of the formulation
- Previous systemic treatment with adalimumab
- Cancer
- Life expectancy <1 year

facility.name: Servicio de Oftalmologia. Hospital Universitario Vall d'Hebron
